Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: {? | $(this.trait:override:examine) |$(this.trait:override:examine)| $(this.trait:furcolor) $(this.trait:sexname), with a small head, pointed ears, $(this.trait:eyecolor) slitted eyes, a $(this.trait:furcolor) furry body, and four limber legs. A long tail follows behind {? | $(this.trait:woundname) |. appears to be $(this.trait:woundname)ly wounded.|.}}
An long back of a $(this.trait:sexname), covered in $(this.trait:furcolor) fur, ending at the base of the tail.
A fuzzy belly of a $(this.trait:sexname), covered in $(this.trait:furcolor) fur, surrounded by legs with sharp claws.
A cat's claw, sharp, but typically hidden in the paw.
A cat's claws, sharp, but typically hidden in the paws.
An ordinary pair of pointy feline ears.
An ordinary pair of feline ears.
A cat's eye with $(this.trait:eyecolor) irises and a vertical slit.
A cat's eyebrow with long whiskers leading above the face.
A pair of cat's eyebrows, each with long whiskers leading above the face.
An ordinary pair of cat's eyebrows.
A pair of $(this.trait:eyecolor) cat's eyes, each with {slitted|} {catlike|feline} pupils{.| that change shape depending on the brightness.}
An ordinary pair of $(this.trait:eyecolor) cat's eyes.
An ordinary face of a $(this.trait:variant) $(this.trait:sexname), covered in $(this.trait:furcolor) fur with whiskers, eyes, ears, nose, and a mouth.
's head all covered in $(this.trait:furcolor) fur, with two $(this.trait:eyecolor) slitted eyes, two pointy ears, a furless moist nose and a small mouth with sharp white teeth.
A cat's head covered in $(this.trait:furcolor) fur.
An ordinary leg of a $(this.trait:variant) $(this.trait:sexname), covered in $(this.trait:furcolor) fur.
Four ordinary legs of a $(this.trait:variant) $(this.trait:sexname), covered in $(this.trait:furcolor) fur.
An ordinary cat's nose, bare of fur and slightly pink and moist, with two nostrils for breathing through.
A cat's nose, bare of fur.
An ordinary cat's paw, with the $(this.trait:furcolor) fur hiding sharp claws.
Four ordinary paws of , with the $(this.trait:furcolor) fur hiding sharp claws.
A side of a cat's body, covered in $(this.trait:furcolor) fur.
The sides of a cat's body, covered in $(this.trait:furcolor) fur.
The whiskers of , long and rising up from the sides of face.
is {? | $(this.trait:woundname) |wounded, of $(this.trait:woundname) importance{? equal | $(this.trait:wound-count) | 3 |, requiring the immediate attention of a Healer}. |not wounded.}

Core:Properties.Core:Property: "set this.trait:sex to male :: set this.trait:sexname to tomcat :: goto 0090"
"set this.trait:sex to female :: set this.trait:sexname to cat :: goto 0090"
"if \$prop(this.trait:furcolor) = nil then set this.trait:furcolor to tabby"
"if \$prop(this.trait:eyecolor) = nil then set this.trait:eyecolor to gray"
"emit.actor Beginning update :: call bilbo:auto:start :: emit.actor Done update"

Notes:Category.Notes:Note: This is a property based UrCat -- still a work in progress, but basically working.

In addition, all the former-CNPC cat reactions are now in Bilbo in UrCat -- as soon as bilbo force works, I'll add the former-CNPC cat actions which will allow UrCat to completely replace cat in the CNPC system.

Basically UrCat works now, but if you want to change any characteristics you do +setprop of trait:sex trait:furcolor and trait:eyecolor and +update to make sure the adjectives match the descriptions (when you do the +setprop it will immediately show the change in the look \& examine desc as they both uses SAM, however, +update is required to make sure that sex, names, and adjectives are all correct -- like 'look at gray cat' 'look at tomcat' etc.) trait:override:look and trait:override:examine also work, but unlike UrMale/Female, the properties must be nil'ed and not changed to 'none'. +wound and heal work, but its not clear that healing happens at the end of the healing period.

Ur is a little bit more sophisticated (and thus simplier) then Brian's style of doing generic objects. For instance: single generic object for both male and female cats; autoscripts all in DB -- none in urobject itself; a single DB; uses sam for descriptions so no deleting descriptions and rewriting them; auto:start react:+update etc. all call a single function.
In progress: I want to add +alter/+morph, variant, comment, full healing, death, autopilot flag, autopilot actions, and a few other things as well.
